description: These iconic Italian cookies, known as Abbracci (meaning “hugs”), are a delightful combination of light and dark shortbread doughs.

instructions: 1. Prepare the Base Dough: Place the softened butter, sugar, honey, and a pinch of salt in a bowl. Mix together using your hands until well combined. Gradually add 1 cup of flour sifted with baking powder. Knead until the mixture begins to come together. Add the egg and liquid cream, and continue kneading until a soft, smooth dough forms. 2. Divide and Flavor the Dough: Divide the dough into two equal portions using a kitchen scale for precision. In one portion, mix in 1 tbsp of flour to create the light dough. In the other portion, mix in 1 tbsp of cocoa powder to create the dark dough. Knead each dough separately until the additions are fully incorporated. 3. Shape the Cookies: Divide each dough into small pieces, weighing about 10 g (0.35 oz) each. Roll each piece into a small sausage shape. Chill the dough shapes in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to firm up. 4. Assemble the Abbracci: Take one light dough sausage and one dark dough sausage. Overlap the ends to form a circle, alternating which end goes over and under. Gently press the overlapping tips together to secure the shape. Place the assembled cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 5. Bake the Cookies: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Bake the cookies in a static oven for 18–20 minutes, or until they are set but not browned. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool completely on the baking sheet before serving.
